messages.message: Are you targeting the crafting-managed rabbitmq or are you starting your own with ppy?
:ack: I haven’t encountered this yet but happy to take a look! I’m at my vet’s office now but should be back in the next 20-30 min :)
@Sayd sorry for the late update, you seem to have a massive file service log on your sandbox that is likely impacting a bunch of other stuff that needs to use the disk -- all good if I delete this?
thank you so much for looking into this
any idea for this happened? i don't think i did anything special with file service
I honestly have no clue haha, I've never seen a log file take up so much space before :joy:

also, for your rabbitmq connection configuration, I'd suggest editing `/home/owner/instabase/distributed-tasks/celery/app-tasks/deployment/local/docker-env.json` to set
```"broker_api_url": "http://guest:guest@rabbitmq:5672/api",
"rabbit_mq_url": "rabbitmq",```
you're currently configured to use `docker.for.mac.localhost`, which would normally point to a rabbitmq container managed by ppy rather than crafting!
